H0.text: The revolution of Earth around the Sun is the factor most responsible for the direction of land and sea breezes in coastal regions, as observed by Felicity when a breeze blew in from the ocean during the day and out toward the ocean at night.

H1.text: The uneven heating between the land and water is the factor most responsible for the direction of land and sea breezes in coastal regions, as observed when Felicity saw a breeze blow in from the ocean during the day and out toward the ocean at night.

H2.text: The gravitational pull of Earth on the atmosphere is the factor most responsible for the direction of land and sea breezes in coastal regions, as observed by Felicity when a breeze blew in from the ocean during the day and blew out toward the ocean at night.

H3.text: The daily rise and fall of tides in a regular pattern is the factor most responsible for the direction of land and sea breezes in coastal regions, as observed by Felicity when a breeze blew in from the ocean during the day and out toward the ocean at night.

A4.text: Sea breezes and land breezes develop due to differences in air pressure created by the differing heat capacities of water and dry land.

A5.text: The strength of the sea breeze is directly proportional to the temperature difference between the land and the sea.
